page_analysis.text_content:
Fig 7 Entry feature with gabled roof



Note: If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway
the area will be counted as follows:

* In this example, a portion of the entryway is recessed
  beyond the house facade and roof. It is included in the
  area that counts.

* The area is measured to the outside material of the entry-
  way feature.

* The area counts TWICE toward gross floor area.

roof material

visual_elements.description: An isometric (3D) view of a house entrance with a gabled roof over a porch. It is labeled 'Isometric View'. The diagram includes annotations for 'Height' (measured from 'Grade' to the 'Intersection of front facade and top of roof material at ridge') and 'Grade'. A dashed line indicates the vertical height measurement.

A 2D side elevation view of the gabled entry feature, labeled 'Side Elevation'. This diagram also shows the 'Height' measurement from 'Grade' to the ridge line, consistent with the isometric view. A dashed line indicates the vertical height measurement.

A 2D floor plan of the porch, labeled 'Porch Floor Plan'. It shows the main house wall as a thick solid line. It has two key annotations: 'Outline of entryway roof' pointing to a thin solid line representing the roof overhang, and 'Outline of entryway floor area that counts TWICE if entryway is vaulted' pointing to a thick dashed line representing the floor area. A curved line indicates a door swing.

structural_elements.main_heading: Fig 7 Entry feature with gabled roof

additional_notes: The page number '12' is located at the bottom left corner.
The word 'TWICE' is capitalized for emphasis in the main note and in the annotation on the 'Porch Floor Plan' diagram.
The page appears to be a clean digital copy or high-quality photocopy with no handwritten marks or stamps.
cross_references: The text refers to 'gross floor area', which is a technical term likely defined elsewhere in the document.
